posts.post_content: This card is probably the greatest combo deck finisher of the past decade. It's way more efficient than [Brain Freeze](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Brain Freeze) in terms of spells required in a turn to get your storm count into the lethal range, and if you're playing in Legacy or Vintage you have access to [Dark Ritual](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dark Ritual), which makes storm decks nuts. 5/5
posts.html:
This card is probably the greatest combo deck finisher of the past decade. It's way more efficient than Brain Freeze in terms of spells required in a turn to get your storm count into the lethal range, and if you're playing in Legacy or Vintage you have access to Dark Ritual, which makes storm decks nuts. 5/5

posts.post_content: @reanimatesucks: Back when this was around (and in Vintage) there were tons ridiculous of mana ramping things, such as [Black Lotus](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Black Lotus), the Moxes, and [Dark Ritual](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dark Ritual). There are also a whole bunch of free spells like [Ornithopter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ornithopter). What they would do is play free stuff and mana ramping to get out huge amounts of spells, then play this and do obscene amounts of damage on the first turn. Wash, rinse, and repeat. Or, if you wanna be fancy, save a [Yawgmoth's Will](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Yawgmoth's Will) and do it all again! If you had in your first hand a swamp, two [Dark Rituals](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dark Rituals), [Yawgmoth's Will](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Yawgmoth's Will), and two [Ornithopters](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ornithopters), you cast swamp, two [Dark Ritual](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dark Ritual)s, two [Ornithopters](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ornithopters) (or another [Dark Ritual](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dark Ritual) or one mana spell),then [Yawgmoth's Will](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Yawgmoth's Will), then this, which is 10 damage, and you gain ten life. Posted By: TheWrathofShane (9/1/2012 12:17:00 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
First turn:  
  
Swamp  
[Dark Ritual](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dark Ritual)  
[Entomb](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Entomb), search for [Griselbrand](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Griselbrand)  
[Exhume](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Exhume) or [Animate Dead](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Animate Dead) to put Griselbrand on the battlefield  
Pay 14 life, draw 14 cards  
[Lotus Petal](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lotus Petal)  
[Memnite](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Memnite) or [Putrid Imp](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Putrid Imp)  
[Culling the Weak](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Culling the Weak)  
[Dark Ritual](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dark Ritual)  
Any card with CMC 0 or 1  
Any card with CMC 0 or 1  
[Tendrils of Agony](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Tendrils of Agony) for 20 life  
  
GG  
  
As long as you can get the first turn Dark Ritual into Entomb and Exhume / Animate Dead, you can usually combo off right then and there. And in multiplayer, the first Tendrils allows you to draw more cards and keep the combo going! Current record is 520 damage on the first turn ([Yawgmoth's Will](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Yawgmoth's Will) is in the deck too for the lulz).  
  
Only downside is that I no longer have friends.
posts.html:

Culling the Weak
Dark Ritual
Any card with CMC 0 or 1
Any card with CMC 0 or 1
Tendrils of Agony for 20 life

GG

As long as you can get the first turn Dark Ritual into Entomb and Exhume / Animate Dead, you can usually combo off right then and there. And in multiplayer, the first Tendrils allows you to draw more cards and keep the combo going! Current record is 520 damage on the first turn (Yawgmoth's Will is in the deck too for the lulz).

Only downside is that I no longer have friends.

Posted By: TheShadow344 (7/10/2012 12:59:17 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
@Superllama  
Those things might happen in Vintage, but never anywhere else. The only card you mentioned that ever shared standard with Tendrils of Agony is [Ornithopter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ornithopter). Even Dark Ritual was last printed four years before Tendrils.  
Also, you would need an absurdly perfect draw to pull off a win the way you describe.  
  
Realistically, Tendrils of Agony is a finisher in a U/B control deck. Control the board until you can storm up enough for a kill (perhaps using [Mind's Desire](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mind's Desire)?).
posts.html:
@Superllama
Those things might happen in Vintage, but never anywhere else. The only card you mentioned that ever shared standard with Tendrils of Agony is Ornithopter. Even Dark Ritual was last printed four years before Tendrils.
Also, you would need an absurdly perfect draw to pull off a win the way you describe.

Realistically, Tendrils of Agony is a finisher in a U/B control deck. Control the board until you can storm up enough for a kill (perhaps using Mind's Desire?).

posts.post_content:
I faced a guy who made a deck that revolved around this card
  
He would put Cabal Rituals , Dark rituals , any kind of tudor , any card that costs 0 mana (Lion's eye diamond , ect.) and a Tendrils of agony , with all the mana gained from his cabal and dark rituals , he would use a Yawgmoth's will to repeat the process of using most of his deck's spells , then when he's finished he would play a Tendrils of agony that he got from all the black tudors and storm my face for 20+ damage in turn 2 at the least....and then he would laugh as he won the game with 40ish life

posts.post_content:
@shocker300 - there's a reason why this isn't rated near 5 :   
because it does very little on its own.  
4 mana for some life swing doesn't cut it.  
  
It requires *many* other cards in combination to be effective, unlike the true 5-star cards in Magic, like Ancestral Recall, Time Walk, Black Lotus, etc.
